title: The 15 Best Ways to Answer "Tell Me About Yourself" on a Dating App

steps.title: Dating apps have profiles for a reason.
steps.content: Dating apps have profiles for a reason. Scan your matchâ€™s profile and any previous messages to see if you have any interests or experiences in common you can share. Have you both traveled to South Africa? Talk about it! Theyâ€™re more likely to feel a connection with you if you show them you have some things in common and have been paying attention to their profile, pictures, and chats. [1] X Research source Go for something like: â€œIâ€™m addicted to pop music and Ariana Grande. I see youâ€™re also a fan!â€ â€œI spend a lot of time in nature and love exploring the great outdoors (couldnâ€™t help but notice your national park pictures, they look amazing!)â€ â€œIâ€™m always reading and on the lookout for new book recommendations. Looks like youâ€™ve got quite the book collection as well. Any suggestions for me?â€

steps.title: Talk about what makes you the most interesting person on the planet.
steps.content: Talk about what makes you the most interesting person on the planet. Chances are youâ€™re not the only person on the app telling your match about themselves. Niche or rare experiences make you stand out from the crowd and make for more memorable conversations. Use fun facts or quick stories to make normal activities seem interesting: â€œI own every Metallica tour t-shirtâ€ is a lot cooler than â€œI like concerts.â€ â€œI love teaching my 3rd grade math class. One time we researched celebrity outfits and calculated how much their looks cost.â€ â€œIâ€™ve traveled to 17 countries so far, and Iâ€™ve tried bagels from each one to see who does it best.â€

steps.title: Make your intentions clear to avoid confusion or hurt feelings.
steps.content: Make your intentions clear to avoid confusion or hurt feelings. Tell your match what youâ€™re looking to get out of the dating app experience. Are you looking for a long-term relationship? Do you only want casual dates right now? This is the time to make sure youâ€™re both on the same page about what you want. Say something like: â€œIâ€™m mainly interested in casual dates and meeting people right now, but would be open to something more serious if the chemistryâ€™s right.â€ â€œIâ€™m on here to find a long-term girlfriend I can settle down and build a life together with.â€ â€œIâ€™m looking for a fun summer fling before I move to France in the fall.â€ Remember, youâ€™re free to say as much or as little as you want. A good rule of thumb is to keep your answer around 70% about you and 30% about what youâ€™re looking for in a partner or relationship. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Share important facts that would affect a potential relationship with you.
steps.content: Share important facts that would affect a potential relationship with you. If youâ€™re only in town for a few more months because you got a new job and are moving soon, mention that. A match looking for a long-term relationship would feel blindsided later on if you hit it off and then told them you had to leave. Give them the information that you would want to know about them. [3] X Research source Try something like: â€œIâ€™m leaving in a few weeks to go back to school in California, so weâ€™d be doing some long distance chatting most of the year.â€ â€œI work night shifts most of the time and my schedule is pretty opposite to most peopleâ€™s.â€ Itâ€™s up to you to decide what is relevant to share. Being a parent, having a job where you travel frequently, or living part-time in another country are all potential things you might want your match to know. Use your judgment to determine what they need to know about you.

steps.title: Give fun details that show what youâ€™re doing at the moment.
steps.content: Give fun details that show what youâ€™re doing at the moment. Tell your match about a new project at work you just started, your most recent hike if you love the outdoors, or a new recipe you tried if youâ€™re a great baker. You can go in depth about anything. The details communicate more about you, and your match will start to get a picture of what your life actually looks like. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Psychological Association Leading scientific and professional organization of licensed psychologists Go to source Instead of a boring â€œI like soccer,â€ try a more detailed sentence like â€œI love playing soccer with my friends and weâ€™re planning a pickup game tomorrow.â€ Go for â€œIâ€™m psyched about a new project at work where I get to photograph fancy desserts for a restaurantâ€™s Instagram accountâ€ instead of â€œI work in social media.â€ â€œI just ran my fastest 10K race ever last week. Canâ€™t wait for the next one!â€ sounds a lot more enthusiastic than â€œIâ€™m a runner.â€

steps.title: Your match already knows some basics about you from your profile.
steps.content: Your match already knows some basics about you from your profile. You donâ€™t need to tell them youâ€™re a pharmacist in Louisville since they probably read that when they matched with you. Jump to the highlights that will get a reaction or build on common ground. Your answer should be about the â€œyouâ€ thatâ€™s not obvious from your profile. [5] X Research source Share something like: â€œWhen Iâ€™m not working, Iâ€™m usually out for a walk along the lake or volunteering at a youth center in my neighborhood.â€ â€œFamilyâ€™s really important to me and I try to visit my parents out in the suburbs once or twice a month.â€ â€œI love organizing events and always get asked to plan the holiday parties at work.â€

steps.title: Give the â€œwhyâ€ or â€œhowâ€ behind the facts in your profile.
steps.content: Give the â€œwhyâ€ or â€œhowâ€ behind the facts in your profile. Include a sentence or two that explains why you chose your job, or what inspired you to pick up your latest hobby. Subtle personal details make you seem more interesting, and your match is more likely to open up in response. [6] X Research source For example, try saying something like, â€œIâ€™ve always enjoyed helping people and that inspired me to start my career in nursingâ€ instead of an impersonal â€œIâ€™m a nurse.â€ Keep your answer light and fun. A few personal details go a long way in making a connection, but too many too soon will have your match wishing they swiped left.

steps.title: Emojis
steps.content: Emojis are a great way to express yourself and keep your answer light. Add a smiley face ğŸ˜ after things that make you happy, or a smirk ğŸ˜ if youâ€™re telling a mischievous story or trying to see how flirty your match will get. Thereâ€™s an emoji for just about any feeling or hobby imaginable to help illustrate your messages. [7] X Research source Try using them like this: "Iâ€™m looking someone who loves to cuddle ğŸ¤— physical touch is totally my love language." "I'm a big surfer and love to vacation in places where I can catch new waves ğŸŒŠğŸ„â€â™‚ï¸" Sentences made entirely of emojis are hard to understand and easy to misinterpret. Instead of ğŸ‘â¤ï¸ğŸ—¼, just say "I love Paris" (or "J'adore Paris" if you're trying to score some foreign language points).

steps.title: Only mention details that make for upbeat conversation.
steps.content: Only mention details that make for upbeat conversation. At this point in the game, your match knows very little about you and theyâ€™ll be turned off if your answer is full of personal problems and heavy emotions. Focus on the positives and not on family drama or your latest argument with a friend. [8] X Research source This also applies to sending nudes or sexts. Your conversation might progress to those kinds of messages later, but lewd comments or innuendos are best left unsent in the early stages. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Pretend your match finds everything you say 100% fascinating.
steps.content: Pretend your match finds everything you say 100% fascinating. Go in depth, make niche references, and show youâ€™re passionate. Give them a chance to reciprocate your energy and wit. Youâ€™ll avoid small talk and get right to rich conversations when you assume theyâ€™re just as excited to have a deep chat as you are. [10] X Research source If they know what youâ€™re talking about, great! If they donâ€™t, then you have new opportunities for conversation.

steps.title: Some apps support audio messages for a more personal touch.
steps.content: Some apps support audio messages for a more personal touch. It can be hard to convey an energetic or warm tone over text. Recording your answer as a voice note is a fun and casual way to show off your personality. Plus, you donâ€™t have to worry about fixing your hair or picking up the clothes on the floor of your bedroom since thereâ€™s no video component. [11] X Research source An audio message right off the bat might come on too strong, so stick to text when you first match. If youâ€™re comfortable with your match, ask something like, â€œIs it ok to send you an audio message?â€ or â€œDo you want to swap voice notes instead of texting?â€

steps.title: Convince your match youâ€™re satisfied with where you are in life.
steps.content: Convince your match youâ€™re satisfied with where you are in life. Even if youâ€™re not in love with your job or the city you live in, find a way to put a positive spin on it. If you come off as bored or disinterested in your own life, your match will be just as disinterested in you too. [12] X Research source If you think your job is boring, tell them something redeeming about it like, â€œOffice Max isnâ€™t my dream job, but the schedule lets me pursue my real passion which is music.â€ Then you get to tell them about your music, too. Use exclamation points. Really! Sentences ending with periods read as less sincere, so sprinkle in some exclamation points to show youâ€™re enthusiastic about yourself. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Send a customized message to everyone you talk to.
steps.content: Send a customized message to everyone you talk to. Each match is going to make you think of different stories or fun facts to share. Lean into it and make each dialogue with a match unique for a more rewarding conversation. Repeating the same answer every time takes the fun and spontaneity out of the dating app experience. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Dating apps arenâ€™t about connecting with every person possible.
steps.content: Dating apps arenâ€™t about connecting with every person possible. Be authentic and you will hit it off with the right matches. Send an honest answer based on your interests and experiences instead of on what you see in their profile. If the conversation progresses or you meet in person, theyâ€™ll probably find out you were dishonest. You have little to lose when it comes to your first couple of messages with a new match, so reveal as much or as little as feels right and keep it real.

steps.title: Youâ€™re on a dating app to enjoy yourself and meet new people.
steps.content: Youâ€™re on a dating app to enjoy yourself and meet new people . Responding to messages shouldnâ€™t feel like homework. If it does, put the phone down and do something else for a while. Come back when you feel refreshed and ready to engage in a conversation. [15] X Research source
